data.title: The Death of Franklin D. Roosevelt – 12 April 1945
data.meta_description: In Warm Springs, Georgia, on 12 April 1945, President Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, died after suffering a stroke - he was aged 63. To mark the day, here are two historical newspaper articles that report on the death of '4-term Roosevelt'. Western Morning News - Friday 13 April 1945 Image ©
data.meta_site_name: The British Newspaper Archive Blog | Amazing finds and news from over 300 years of historical newspapers
data.text:
In Warm Springs, Georgia, on 12 April 1945, President Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, died after suffering a stroke – he was aged 63.

To mark the day, here are two historical newspaper articles that report on the death of ‘4-term Roosevelt’.

Western Morning News – Friday 13 April 1945

Image © Northcliffe Media Limited. Image created courtesy of THE BRITISH LIBRARY BOARD.

http://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000329/19450413/052/0003

Dundee Courier – Saturday 14 April 1945

Image © D.C.Thomson & Co. Ltd. Image created courtesy of THE BRITISH LIBRARY BOARD.
